PDF->DOCX (MS Word)

We take your PDF file and recreate it with the same layout in DOCX format (MS Word), paying special attention to:

  1. Technology. You can start the translation workflow in CAT and MT confidently: we took care of correct segmentation, ensured all text is live (including the text on images, charts, seals, stamps, etc.), free of unnecessary tags and perfectly formatted.
  2. Formatting. We format all the content manually: tables, lists, page numbering, headers and footers, styles, references, table of content, etc. When translated, your document keeps perfect layout.
  3. Text. Your text will be spell-checked twice: when formatting by formatter and during the QC by QA manager. We know how the text is important for CAT repetitions and machine translation and handle it with utmost care.
WORKFLOW:
  • OCR
  • formatting
  • spell checking + QC by QA manager.

PDF->PPTX (PowerPoint)

When your PDF file looks like presentation, we recreate it in PPTX format (MS PowerPoint).

The process is the same as PDF->DOCX, putting the focus to graphic design. Technology highlights. When formatting, possibility of expansion of the translated text is especially anticipated. Placing the text, we leave some free space to let the grown text filling it, instead of messing up. This way assures your translated document will have no (or inevitable minimum) of well-known issues.

Send your files
Send your files for quotation
Drag-and-drop files here or choose them with the Browse button
Dead text in DOCX/PPTX

How often do you have to translate a DOCX or PPTX document with some dead text on images – typically, they are charts, screenshots, interfaces, dead tables?

Sadly, this text will not be picked up by your CAT or MT software. We are here to fix it! We will go through the document, find out all the things and turn them into a live text. Depending on your choice, we can recreate it with the same layout, or create a bilanguage table below each thing.

Send your files
Send your files for quotation
Drag-and-drop files here or choose them with the Browse button
Bilingual tables

Whenever you need to provide your client with the translation in a bi-column format, or you need it for any interim purpose, we can do this for you.

We extract the source text into a two-column table with the exact same content in both columns, marking the content in the first one hidden. The CAT tool will ignore the hidden text and only the text in the second column will be picked up. Once the translation is finished, you will have the source text in the first column and the target in the second column. All you need to do it is unhide the content in several clicks.

Send your files
Send your files for quotation
Drag-and-drop files here or choose them with the Browse button
PDF drawings

Have you ever faced a challenge with the drawings inside your PDF document? Yes? No? No worries, we have several ways to provide you with the live text for your favorite CAT or MT tool. Depending on the file, we will be able to offer you:

  1. Paste the drawing into DOCX document and recreate all the text with textboxes.
  2. Paste the drawing into PPTX document and recreate all the text with textboxes.
  3. Create captions inside the PDF file, which will be picked up by your CAT/MT tool.
  4. Create a bilanguage table in DOCX and, optionally, once translated, place the translated text in Photoshop.

If your file has a DWG format (AutoCAD) – great, we support it and have a special process.
